alert.note: Alert for Berks; Carbon; Lehigh; Monroe; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 1:41AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Berks, Lehigh, Carbon, southwestern Monroe and west central Northampton Counties through 215 AM EDT... At 141 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fleetwood, or 12 miles northeast of Reading, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Lehighton, Northampton, Palmerton, Kutztown, Jim Thorpe, Hamburg, Slatington, Fleetwood, Nesquehoning, Bath, Weatherly, Walnutport, Topton, Belfast, Shoemakersville, Lyons, Lenhartsville, Neffs and Coffeetown. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 56 and 84. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 32 and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
